account.title: Top Accounts by HT Balance
account.accountTip3: Showing the last 10000 top accounts only

address.creator: Creator
address.tab6Tip4: are used by developers/external UI providers for keeping track of contract actions and for auditing

block.blockHeightTip: Also known as Block Number. The block height, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of the new block.
block.timestampTip: The date and time at which a block is validated.
block.hashTip: The hash of the block header of the current block.
block.transactionTip: The number of transactions in the block. Internal transaction is transactions as a result of contract execution that involves HT value.
block.validatedTip: Validator who successfully include the block into the blockchain.
block.blockRewardTip: For each block, the miner is rewarded with a finite amount of HT on top of the fees paid for all transactions in the block.
block.difficultyTip: The amount of effort required to mine a new block. The difficulty algorithm may adjust according to time.
block.totalDifficultyTip: Total difficulty of the chain until this block.
block.sizeTip: The block size is actually determined by the block's gas limit.
block.gasUsedTip: The total gas used in the block and its percentage of gas filled in the block.
block.gasLimitTip: Total gas limit provided by all transactions in the block.
block.dataTip: Any data that can be included by the miner in the block.
block.parentHashTip: The hash of the block from which this block was generated, also known as its parent block.
block.sha3UnclesTip: The mechanism which Huobi Javascript RLP encodes an empty string.
block.nonceTip: Block nonce is a value used during mining to demonstrate proof of work for a block.

contract.verifyTip1: Source code verification provides transparency for users interacting with smart contracts.By uploading the source code, HecoScan will match the compiled code with that on the blockchain. Just like contracts, a 'smart contract' should provide end users with more information on what they are 'digitally signing' for and give users an opportunity to audit the code to independently verify that it actually does what it is supposed to do.
contract.contractAddress: Please enter the Contract Address you would like to verify
contract.selectLicense: Please select Open Source License Type
contract.verifySingleTip: Compiler Type: SINGLE FILE / CONCATENANTED METHOD
contract.verifySingleTip1: A simple and structured interface for verifying smart contracts that fit in a single file
contract.error: Error! Failed to verify Contract Code at 0x...
contract.verifySingleTip2: If the contract compiles correctly at REMIX, it should also compile correctly here.
contract.verifySingleTip3: We have limited support for verifying contracts created by another contract and there is a timeout of up to 45 seconds for each contract compiled.
contract.selectOption: Select the option you used when compiling this contract
contract.runsTip: (Applicable when Optimization = Yes) Optimize for how many times you intend to run the code.Lower values will optimize more for initial deployment cost, higher values will optimize more for high-frequency usage.
contract.runsTip1: Do not change if you are unsure. Previous versions of truffle defaulted to a value of 0
contract.evmTip: When you compile your contract code you can specify the HECO virtual machine version to compile for to avoid particular features or behaviours.
contract.evmTip1: A list of target EVM versions and the compiler-relevant changes introduced at each  version. Backward compatibility is not guaranteed between each version.
contract.codeDetail: Enter the Solidity Contract Code below
contract.uploadSolidity: Please select the Solidity (*.sol) files for upload
contract.contractError: Error! Failed to verify Contract Code.

transaction.txHashTip: A TxHash or transaction hash is a unique 66 characters identifier that is generated whenever a transaction is executed.
transaction.statusTip1: A Status code indicating if the top-level call succeeded or failed (applicable for Post BYZANTIUM blocks only)
transaction.blockTip: The number of the block in which the transaction was recorded. Block confirmation indicate how many blocks since the transaction is validated.
transaction.timestampTip: The date and time at which a transaction is validated.
transaction.fromTip: The sending party of the transaction (could be from a contract address).
transaction.toTip: The receiving party of the transaction (could be a contract address).
transaction.tokensTransferredTip: List of token transferred in the transaction.
transaction.valueTip: The value being transacted in HT and fiat value. Note: You can click the fiat value (if available) to see historical value at the time of transaction.
transaction.valueTip1: The amount of HT to be transferred to the recipient with the transaction
transaction.txFeeTip: Amount paid to the miner for processing the transaction.
transaction.txFeeTip1: Gas Price * Gas Used by Transaction
transaction.gasLimitTip: Maximum amount of gas provided for the transaction. For normal HT transfers, the value is 21,000. For contract this value is higher and bound by block gas limit.
transaction.gasLimitTip1: The amount of GAS supplied for this transaction to happen
transaction.gasUsedTip: The exact units of gas that was used for the transaction.
transaction.gasUsedTip1: The amount of GAS used by this specific transaction alone
transaction.gasPriceTip: Cost per unit of gas specified for the transaction, in Gwei. The higher the gas price the higher chance of getting included in a block.
transaction.gasPriceTip1: The price offered to the miner to purchase this amount of GAS （per GAS）
transaction.nonceTip: Sequential running number for an address, beginning with 0 for the first transaction. For example, if the nonce of a transaction is 10, it would be the 11th transaction sent from the sender's address.
transaction.positionTip: Index position of Transaction in the block
transaction.indexPosition: Index position of Transaction in the block
transaction.inputDataTip: Additional information that is required for the transaction.
transaction.inputDataTip1: The binary data that formed the input to the transaction, either the input data if it was a message call or the contract initialisation if it was a contract creation
transaction.name: Name

status.404Tip: Oops! You have entered an empty search string
status.500: Sorry ! We encountered an unexpected error.

faucet.title: Huobi ECO Chain Test Faucet
faucet.tip1: Automatically send 2 HT to your testnet account, and 6 HT at most.</br>The HT can only be used for testnet.
faucet.tip2: Automatically send 100 Token to your testnet account.</br>The Token can only be used for testnet.
faucet.tips: Click the icon to verify the identity
